alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 3:02PM CDT until June 23 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Wilcox. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camden, Pine Hill, Yellow Bluff, Pine Apple, Shawnee, Pebble Hill, Estelle, Rockwest, Fatama, Dry Forks, Neenah, Nellie, Millers Ferry, Darlington, Rosebud, Coal Bluff, Oak Hill, Sheppard, Caledonia and Ackerville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
